[**Theorem**]{} (Schur’s inequality) Let $A$ be a square $n\times n$
matrix with real (or possibly complex entries). If
$\lambda_1,\ldots, \lambda_n$ are the eigenvalues of $A$, and $D$ is the
diagonal matrix $D=\operatorname{diag}(\lambda_1,\ldots, \lambda_n)$,
then $$\begin{aligned}
\Vert D \Vert_F &\le& \Vert A \Vert_F,\end{aligned}$$ where
$\Vert\cdot \Vert_F$ is the Frobenius matrix norm. Equality holds if and
only if $A$ is a normal matrix.

[9]{} V.V. Prasolov, *Problems and Theorems in Linear Algebra*, American
Mathematical Society, 1994.
